greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of cubes in multiplicative group modulo n.
comment: Cubic analog of A046073. - _Steven Finch_, Mar 01 2006
a(p^k) = (p-1)*p^(k-1)/3 if prime p == 1 mod 6; a(p^k) = (p-1)*p^(k-1) for all other primes p. - _Robert Israel_, Jan 04 2015
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
S. R. Finch and Pascal Sebah, Squares and Cubes Modulo n (arXiv:math.NT/0604465).
maple: if p = 3 then if i=1 then 2 else 2*3^(i-2) fi
seq(mul(b(f[1],f[2]), f = ifactors(n)[2]), n = 1 .. 1000); # _Robert Israel_, Jan 04 2015
results.author: Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Sep 27 2003
